ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Overview of French grammar and resources available for reading French texts
Furthered my reading skills in French and can now read with much greater fluency.
I learned about French grammar and methods for translation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It might have been helpful if the content of class lectures followed along the order in which material is presented in the text book, so we could learn the material on our own and then class could serve as a review and a space to ask questions about what we read in the book.
I would have liked to stick to more of a syllabus schedule, as it was not always clear when tests and assignments were occurring.
Strengths were focused attention to grammar. Improvement would be less translations from homework in class, as it was rather tedious, and more translation drills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It is not possible to learn all of French in a semester, and students should go into this class with reasonable expectations. In retrospect, I do think that I would have benefitted more from taking the online summer program in French, so that I could have dedicated more attention and effort to the class. That being said, I did learn a lot and the professor was excellent.
Yes, for those needing to quickly improve French reading for research purposes.
Yes, I would recommend the course to students attempting to pass translation exams.
